title: Variable atmos.wbgt.tmax-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB (day.wbgt2mmax)
Comment: max 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature (WGBT): Wet Bulb Globe Temperature (WBGT) is a particularly effective indicator of heat stress for active populations such as outdoor workers and athletes. The calculation should be done with: WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air and "P = surface pressure in Pa"
Long name: maximum 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature
Processing notes: The calculation should be done with: WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air, and "P = surface pressure in Pa"

title: Variable atmos.wbgt.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB (day.wbgt2m)
Comment: mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature (WBGT). Wet Bulb Globe Temperature (WBGT) is a particularly effective indicator of heat stress for active populations such as outdoor workers and athletes. The calculation should be done with: WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air and "P = surface pressure in Pa"
Long name: mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature
Processing notes: The calculation should be done with: WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air, and "P = surface pressure in Pa"

title: Variable atmos.rluscs.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (day.rluscs)
Comment: Surface Upwelling Clear-sky Longwave Radiation

title: Variable atmos.noaahi2m.tmax-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB (day.noaahi2mmax)
Comment: max 2m daily NOAA heat index The perceived air temperature when relative humidity is taken into consideration (which makes it feel hotter than the actual air temperature). The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K. NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523(T) + 10.14333127(R) - 0.22475541(T)(R) - 6.83783e-3 sqr(T) - 5.481717e-2 sqr(R) + 1.22874e-3 sqr(T) (R) + 8.5282e-4 (T) sqr(R) - 1.99e-6 sqr(T) sqr(R) where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%)
Processing notes: NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523T + 10.14333127R - 0.22475541TR - 6.83783 x 10-3T2 - 5.481717 x 10-2R2 + 1.22874 x 10-3T2R + 8.5282 x 10-4TR2 - 1.99 x 10-6T2R2 where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%). The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K.

title: Variable atmos.noaahi2m.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB (day.noaahi2m)
Comment: mean 2m daily NOAA heat index. The perceived air temperature when relative humidity is taken into consideration (which makes it feel hotter than the actual air temperature). The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K. NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523(T) + 10.14333127(R) - 0.22475541(T)(R) - 6.83783e-3 sqr(T) - 5.481717e-2 sqr(R) + 1.22874e-3 sqr(T) (R) + 8.5282e-4 (T) sqr(R) - 1.99e-6 sqr(T) sqr(R) where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%)
Processing notes: NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523T + 10.14333127R - 0.22475541TR - 6.83783 x 10-3T2 - 5.481717 x 10-2R2 + 1.22874 x 10-3T2R + 8.5282 x 10-4TR2 - 1.99 x 10-6T2R2 where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%). Heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K.

title: Variable atmos.utendogw.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB (EmonZ.utendogw)
Comment: Zonal mean tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag
Long name: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Processing notes: This is the total tendency due to parameterized orographic gravity wave drag, which is the sum of all possible components of the parameterization (where applicable). We ask that in the Essential Model Documentation modelling centers specify the parameterization scheme used and the specific values of its tunable parameters used for the simulation, and a specification of the part of the gravity wave spectrum that is targeted by the parameterization (e.g., minimally, the effective resolution of the model).

title: Variable atmos.wsg.tmax-h10m-hxy-u.mon.GLB (Emon.wsgmax10m)
Comment: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 10m, monthly
Long name: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 10m
Processing notes: Maximum instantaneous gust over grid cell, recorded monthly. Input data at the highest available frequency, ideally model timesteps, should be used to compute the maximum. Modellers are requested to leave in a comment in the netcdf metadata stating the frequency of the input data.

title: Variable atmos.wsg.tmax-h100m-hxy-u.mon.GLB (Emon.wsgmax100m)
Comment: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 100m, monthly
Long name: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 100m
Processing notes: Maximum instantaneous gust over grid cell, recorded monthly. Input data at the highest available frequency, ideally model timesteps, should be used to compute the maximum. Modellers are requested to leave in a comment in the netcdf metadata stating the frequency of the input data.

title: Variable atmos.tauvogw.tavg-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB (Emon.tauvogw)
Comment: Vertical flux of meridional momentum within the orographic gravity wave parameterization
Long name: Northward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization

title: Variable atmos.tauvnogw.tavg-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB (Emon.tauvnogw)
Comment: Vertical flux of meridional momentum within the non-orographic gravity wave parameterization.
Long name: Northward Reynolds stress from non-orographic gravity wave parameterization

title: Variable atmos.tauuogw.tavg-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB (Emon.tauuogw)
Comment: The vertical flux of zonal momentum within the orographic gravity wave parameterization.
Long name: Eastward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization

title: Variable atmos.tauunowgw.tavg-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB (Emon.tauunowgw)
Comment: Vertical flux of zonal momentum within the non-orographic gravity wave parameterization associated with the westward propagating modes.
Long name: Eastward Reynolds stress from non-orographic westward gravity wave parameterization

title: Variable atmos.tauunoegw.tavg-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB (Emon.tauunoegw)
Comment: Vertical flux of zonal momentum within the non-orographic gravity wave parameterization associated with the eastward propagating modes.
Long name: Eastward Reynolds stress from non-orographic eastward gravity wave parameterization

title: Variable atmos.scldncl.tavg-u-hxy-scl.mon.GLB (Emon.scldncl)
Comment: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops
Long name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops

title: Variable atmos.reffsclwtop.tavg-u-hxy-scl.mon.GLB (Emon.reffsclwtop)
Comment: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud
Long name: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud

title: Variable atmos.reffcclwtop.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.mon.GLB (Emon.reffcclwtop)
Comment: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud
Long name: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud

title: Variable atmos.albsrfc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (Emon.albsrfc)
Comment: surface albedo at grid cell level (i.e. the albedo averaged over all potential subgrid-scale structures) over all wave-bands; this shall apply to all realms (land, ocean, sea ice, land ice)
Processing notes: There is a variable AERmon.albsrfc, but I am not sure whether the definition applies to the description above; furthermore, the variable would also be of relevance outside of the AER focus, hence we may consider whether it should go into another category as well (I had Emon in mind.); Whether this variable should be provided at atmosphere/land or ocean grid, and the respective grid cell metrics, must be discussed.

title: Variable atmos.tntrs.tavg-p39-hy-air.day.GLB (EdayZ.tntrs)
Comment: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to shortwave heating, all sky, with the extended number of vertical levels.
Long name: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to shortwave heating, all sky

title: Variable atmos.tntrl.tavg-p39-hy-air.day.GLB (EdayZ.tntrl)
Comment: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to longwave heating, all sky, with the extended number of vertical levels.
Long name: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to longwave heating, all sky

title: Variable atmos.tntmp.tavg-p39-hy-air.day.GLB (EdayZ.tntmp)
Comment: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to model physics, with the extended number of vertical levels
Long name: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to model physics
Processing notes: This is the total temperature tendency due to parameterized physics, which is the sum of contributes from all relevant parameterizations. We ask that in the Essential Model Documentation modelling centers specify the parameterized process contributing to this tendency, and (where applicable) specific values of their tunable parameters used for the simulation.

title: Variable atmos.tauvogw.tavg-p39-hy-air.day.GLB (EdayZ.tauvogw)
Comment: Zonal mean vertical flux of meridional momentum within the orographic gravity wave parameterization
Long name: Zonal mean northward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization

title: Variable atmos.tauvnogw.tavg-p39-hy-air.day.GLB (EdayZ.tauvnogw)
Comment: Zonal mean vertical wave flux of meridional momentum within the non-orographic gravity wave parameterization
Long name: Zonal mean northward Reynolds stress from non-orographic gravity wave parameterization

title: Variable atmos.tauuogw.tavg-p39-hy-air.day.GLB (EdayZ.tauuogw)
Comment: Zonal mean of the vertical flux of zonal momentum within the orographic gravity wave parameterization
Long name: Zonal mean eastward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization

title: Variable atmos.tauunowgw.tavg-p39-hy-air.day.GLB (EdayZ.tauunowgw)
Comment: Zonal mean vertical wave flux of zonal momentum within the non-orographic gravity wave parameterization associated with the westward propagating modes.
Long name: Zonal mean eastward Reynolds stress from non-orographic westward gravity wave parameterization

title: Variable atmos.tauunoegw.tavg-p39-hy-air.day.GLB (EdayZ.tauunoegw)
Comment: Zonal mean vertical wave flux of zonal momentum within the non-orographic gravity wave parameterization associated with the eastward propagating modes.
Long name: Zonal mean eastward Reynolds stress from non-orographic eastward gravity wave parameterization

Comment: Tendency of northward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag

title: Variable atmos.utendogw.tavg-p19-hxy-air.day.GLB (Eday.utendogw)
Comment: Tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag
Long name: Tendency of eastward wind due to orographic gravity waves
Processing notes: This is the total tendency due to parameterized orographic gravity wave drag, which is the sum of all possible components of the parameterization (where applicable). We ask that in the Essential Model Documentation modelling centers specify the parameterization scheme used and the specific values of its tunable parameters used for the simulation, and a specification of the part of the gravity wave spectrum that is targeted by the parameterization (e.g., minimally, the effective resolution of the model).

title: Variable atmos.utendnogw.tavg-p19-hxy-air.day.GLB (Eday.utendnogw)
Comment: Tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized non-orographic gravity wave drag
Long name: Tendency of eastward wind due to non-orographic gravity waves
Processing notes: This is the total tendency due to parameterized non-orographic gravity wave drag, which is the sum of all possible components of the parameterization (where applicable). We ask that in the Essential Model Documentation modelling centers specify the parameterization scheme used and the specific values of its tunable parameters used for the simulation, and a specification of the part of the gravity wave spectrum that is targeted by the parameterization (e.g., minimally, the effective resolution of the model).

title: Variable atmos.intvaw.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (Eday.intvaw)
Comment: Vertically integrated northward moisture transport (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of northward wind by total water mass per unit mass)

title: Variable atmos.intvadse.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (Eday.intvadse)
Comment: Vertically integrated northward dry static energy transport (cp.T +zg).v (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of northward wind by dry static_energy per mass unit)
Long name: Vertically Integrated Northward Dry Static Energy Transport

title: Variable atmos.intuaw.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (Eday.intuaw)

title: Variable atmos.intuadse.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (Eday.intuadse)
Comment: Vertically integrated eastward dry static energy transport (cp.T +zg).v (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of eastward wind by dry static_energy per mass unit)
Long name: Vertically Integrated Eastward Dry Static Energy Transport

title: Variable atmos.wap.tpt-p6-hxy-air.3hr.GLB (E3hrPt.wap6)
Cell methods: area: mean where air time: point
Comment: Omega (=dp/dt) on 6 pressure levels in the lower troposphere
Processing notes: 950 hPa to 700 hPa with an interval of 50h Pa for vertical layers (6 vertical layers)

title: Variable atmos.va.tpt-p6-hxy-air.3hr.GLB (E3hrPt.va6)
Cell methods: area: mean where air time: point
Comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction) on 6 pressure levels in the lower troposphere
Processing notes: 950 hPa to 700 hPa with an interval of 50h Pa for vertical layers (6 vertical layers)

title: Variable atmos.ua.tpt-p6-hxy-air.3hr.GLB (E3hrPt.ua6)
Cell methods: area: mean where air time: point
Comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction) on 6 pressure levels in the lower troposphere
Processing notes: 950 hPa to 700 hPa with an interval of 50h Pa for vertical layers (6 vertical layers)

title: Variable atmos.ta.tpt-p6-hxy-air.3hr.GLB (E3hrPt.ta6)
Cell methods: area: mean where air time: point
Comment: Air temperature on 6 pressure levels in the lower troposphere
Processing notes: 950 hPa to 700 hPa with an interval of 50h Pa for vertical layers (6 vertical layers)

title: Variable atmos.hus.tpt-p6-hxy-air.3hr.GLB (E3hrPt.hus6)
Cell methods: area: mean where air time: point
Comment: Specific humidity on 6 pressure levels in the lower troposphere
Processing notes: 950 hPa to 700 hPa with an interval of 50h Pa for vertical layers (6 vertical layers)

title: Variable atmos.wsg.tmax-h10m-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.wsgmax10m)
Comment: Wind speed gust maximum at 10m above surface
Long name: Maximum Speed of Wind Gust at 10m
Processing notes: Time maximum required

title: Variable atmos.wsg.tmax-h100m-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.wsgmax100m)
Comment: Wind speed gust maximum at 100m above surface
Long name: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 100m
Processing notes: Wind speed gust maximum at 100m above surface - hourly output

title: Variable atmos.vas.tpt-h10m-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.vas)
Comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction) at 10 meters above the surface.

title: Variable atmos.va.tpt-h100m-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.va100m)
Comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction) at 100m above the surface.
Processing notes: Instantaneous values

title: Variable atmos.uas.tpt-h10m-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.uas)
Comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction) at 10 meters above the surface.

title: Variable atmos.ua.tpt-h100m-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.ua100m)
Comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction) at 100m above the surface
Processing notes: Instantaneous values

title: Variable atmos.ts.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.ts)
Comment: Surface temperature (skin for open ocean)

title: Variable atmos.sfcWind.tavg-h10m-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.sfcWind)
Comment: Hourly near-surface wind speed at 10m above the ground

title: Variable atmos.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.rsus)
Comment: Surface upwelling shortwave radiation

title: Variable atmos.rsdsdiff.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.rsdsdiff)
Comment: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Processing notes: This is a 3-hour mean flux.

title: Variable atmos.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.rsds)
Comment: Hourly downward solar radiation flux at the surface
Long name: Hourly downward solar radiation flux at the surface

title: Variable atmos.rlus.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.rlus)
Comment: Hourly surface upwelling shortwave radiation

title: Variable atmos.rlds.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.rlds)
Comment: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Processing notes: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

title: Variable atmos.ps.tpt-u-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.ps)
Comment: Surface pressure.
Processing notes: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

title: Variable atmos.huss.tpt-h2m-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.huss)
Comment: Specific humidity at 2m.
Processing notes: This is sampled synoptically (instantaneous)

title: Variable atmos.hurs.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.hurs)
Comment: Relative humidity at 2m above the surface
Long name: Hourly relative humidity at the surface

title: Variable atmos.hfss.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.hfss)
Comment: Hourly surface upward sensible heat flux

title: Variable atmos.hfls.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.hfls)
Comment: Hourly surface upward latent heat flux

title: Variable atmos.clt.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.30S-90S (E1hr.clt)
Comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

title: Variable atmos.bldep.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.GLB (E1hr.bldep)
Comment: Boundary Layer depth

title: Variable atmos.clwvimodis.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.clwvimodis)
Comment: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column) as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.

title: Variable atmos.clmodisliquidReff.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.clmodisliquidReff)
Comment: Percentage liquid-cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of LWP (cloud liquid water path) and r_eff (droplet effective radius). The effective radius bin edges are defined in the COSP simulator (see lines 134-152 of cosp_config.F90: <https://github.com/CFMIP/COSPv2.0/blob/master/src/cosp_config.F90>)
Long name: MODIS Liquid Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Processing notes: 7 LWP levels x 6 effective radius levels.

title: Variable atmos.clmodisliquid.tavg-p7c-hxy-air.mon.GLB (CFmon.clmodisliquid)
Comment: Percentage liquid-cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same used by clisccp (ISCCP simulator).
Long name: MODIS Liquid Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Processing notes: 7 pressure levels x 7 optical depth levels.

title: Variable atmos.clmodisiceReff.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.clmodisiceReff)
Comment: Percentage ice-cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of cloud IWP (cloud ice water path) and r_eff (effective droplet size). The effective radius bin edges are defined in the COSP simulator (see lines 134-152 of cosp_config.F90: <https://github.com/CFMIP/COSPv2.0/blob/master/src/cosp_config.F90>)
Long name: MODIS Ice Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Processing notes: 7 IWP levels x 6 effective radius levels. Metric is further described in [Pincus 2023](https://essd.copernicus.org/articles/15/2483/2023/essd-15-2483-2023-discussion.html)

title: Variable atmos.clmodisice.tavg-p7c-hxy-air.mon.GLB (CFmon.clmodisice)
Comment: Percentage ice-cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same as used by clisccp output from the ISCCP satellite simulator.
Long name: MODIS Ice Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Processing notes: 7 pressure levels x 7 optical depth levels.

title: Variable atmos.clmodis.tavg-p7c-hxy-air.mon.GLB (CFmon.clmodis)
Comment: Percentage of total cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same used by the ISCCP instrument simulator. This is the equivalent MODIS version of the ISCCP _clisccp _variable.
Processing notes: 7 pressure levels x 7 optical depth levels (x latitude x longitude x time).

title: Variable atmos.clivimodis.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.clivimodis)
Comment: Mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column) as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.

title: Variable atmos.hur.tavg-700hPa-hxy-air.day.GLB (CFday.hur700)
Comment: Relative humidity at 700 hPa

Comment: 6 hourly instantaneous temperature at 5 pressure levels in the UTLS region (150, 175, 200, 225, and 250 hPa)
Long name: 6 hourly instantaneous temperature in the UTLS region

Comment: Vertically integrated northward moisture transport (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of northward wind by total water mass per unit mass)

title: Variable atmos.hur.tpt-850hPa-hxy-air.6hr.GLB (6hrPlevPt.hur850)
Cell methods: area: mean where air time: point
Comment: Relative humidity at 850 hPa

title: Variable atmos.hur.tpt-500hPa-hxy-air.6hr.GLB (6hrPlevPt.hur500)
Cell methods: area: mean where air time: point
Comment: Relative humidity at 500 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous

title: Variable atmos.hur.tpt-100hPa-hxy-u.6hr.GLB (6hrPlevPt.hur100)
Comment: Relative humidity at 100 hPa

title: Variable atmos.ts.tavg-u-hxy-u.6hr.GLB (6hrPlev.ts)
Comment: Surface temperature (skin for open ocean)

title: Variable atmos.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-u.6hr.GLB (6hrPlev.rsds)
Comment: Surface downwelling shortwave radiation

title: Variable atmos.rlds.tavg-u-hxy-u.6hr.GLB (6hrPlev.rlds)
Comment: Surface downwelling longwave radiation

title: Variable atmos.ps.tavg-u-hxy-u.6hr.GLB (6hrPlev.ps)
Comment: Surface pressure, not mean sea level pressure

title: Variable atmos.prsn.tavg-u-hxy-u.6hr.GLB (6hrPlev.prsn)
Comment: Precipitation rate at surface: Includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase.

title: Variable atmos.prra.tavg-u-hxy-u.6hr.GLB (6hrPlev.prra)
Comment: Precipitation rate at surface: Includes precipitation of all forms of water in the liquid phase

title: Variable atmos.huss.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.6hr.GLB (6hrPlev.huss)
Comment: Near-surface (usually, 2 meter) specific humidity.

title: Variable atmos.zg.tpt-al-hxy-u.6hr.GLB (6hrLev.zg)
Comment: Geopotential height
Processing notes: on all model levels

title: Variable atmos.bldep.tpt-u-hxy-u.3hr.GLB (3hrPt.bldep)
Comment: Boundary Layer Depth every 3 hours

title: Variable atmos.va.tavg-h100m-hxy-u.3hr.GLB (3hr.va100m)
Comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction) at 100m

title: Variable atmos.ua.tavg-h100m-hxy-u.3hr.GLB (3hr.ua100m)
Comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction) at 100m

title: Variable atmos.rluscs.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (Amon.rluscs)
Comment: Surface Upwelling Clear-sky Longwave Radiation

title: Variable atmos.prra.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (Amon.prra)
Comment: Rainfall rate at surface: Includes precipitation of all forms of water in the liquid phase

title: Variable atmos.aod550volso4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (Amon.aod550volso4)
Comment: This is the monthly averaged aerosol optical thickness at 550 nm due to stratospheric volcanic sulphate aerosols
Long name: Monthly Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm Due to Stratospheric Volcanic Aerosols
